revised_title: Observations on Colors and Dyes in Vegetables and Animals
tldr: The author discusses various methods to increase the range of colors in dyes and fix colors in fabrics. They explore the effects of different salts on the colors of flowers, fruits, and animals, and suggest that some plants and animals can yield vibrant colors that can be used for dyeing fabrics. The author also mentions a new black dye they discovered from an English vegetable, which is resistant to fire and salt.
